description: Detached homes designed to house a single family, often with a private yard.
Multi-floor homes that share one or more walls with adjacent properties, often with small outdoor spaces.
Units in a larger building, typically rented, that share common walls, floors, and ceilings with neighboring units.
Housing specifically designed for students, often located near educational institutions, including dormitories or shared apartments.
Residences designed for seniors, offering various levels of care from independent living to assisted living and memory care.
Short-term rental homes or apartments typically rented for vacations or short stays, often fully furnished and located in popular tourist destinations.
Residential buildings divided into two or three separate units, which can be rented or owned.
Shared housing arrangements with common areas and private bedrooms, often offering a community-based living environment.
Pre-fabricated homes that are manufactured off-site and then assembled on-site.
